content: Chrysler is different than Ford or GM in that it is privately held. (You can't buy Chrysler stock). The merger with Daimler didn't work, and they messed up by dropping Plymouth as an entry level brand. They are in need of small fuel efficient cars, something they are really lacking. Fiat needs a dealer network in order to be more than a novelty in the US. It looks like Fiat will aquire 55% of Chrysler in exchange for retooling Chrysler plants to build Fiat cars.
reply: Chrysler is different than Ford or GM in that it is privately held. (You can't buy Chrysler stock). The merger with Daimler didn't work, and they messed up by dropping Plymouth as an entry level brand. They are in need of small fuel efficient cars, something they are really lacking. Fiat needs a dealer network in order to be more than a novelty in the US. It looks like Fiat will aquire 55% of Chrysler in exchange for retooling Chrysler plants to build Fiat cars.
title: FIAT???

content: i just junked my dodge i got it brand new in 1993 and it hasnt ran in 3 years before i canned it... the problems that car had i could list that would take up this forum..... no but there were a ton of problems that car had that was factory defective that it really peed me off.... for one the car was mixed metric and stranded.. that was just the first then the defective alternator belt assembly and flywheels.. its whole configuration was flawed and the belt when wet would fly off..... and what kept it dry was the plastic casing and it was just flawed design...
reply: i just junked my dodge i got it brand new in 1993 and it hasnt ran in 3 years before i canned it... the problems that car had i could list that would take up this forum..... no but there were a ton of problems that car had that was factory defective that it really peed me off.... for one the car was mixed metric and stranded.. that was just the first then the defective alternator belt assembly and flywheels.. its whole configuration was flawed and the belt when wet would fly off..... and what kept it dry was the plastic casing and it was just flawed design...

content: because of protectionist trade practices..most of the "fiats are a piece of crap" type comments probably come from a time when fiat was in trouble itself. fiat makes a really good 3 cylinder turbo diesel that gets 40 mpg, i have a army buddy still in germany that drives one. fiat is not a bad car. like it was said fiat or bankrupcy. i think they ought to let all safe makes of vehicles into the u.s. no matter where or who makes them..then you will have real competition and the u.s. makers will have to get their heads out of their arses.
reply: because of protectionist trade practices..most of the "fiats are a piece of crap" type comments probably come from a time when fiat was in trouble itself. fiat makes a really good 3 cylinder turbo diesel that gets 40 mpg, i have a army buddy still in germany that drives one. fiat is not a bad car. like it was said fiat or bankrupcy. i think they ought to let all safe makes of vehicles into the u.s. no matter where or who makes them..then you will have real competition and the u.s. makers will have to get their heads out of their arses.
